result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronnie A Rutledge Sr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant is to pay $440 for 'Buy Money' to West Central MEG

Restitution will be paid under the terms of a payment plan to be established with the PO but calling for no less than 2.5% of gross wages to be paid toward restitution and to be enforced through a wage assignment
.

Obtain and maintain full-time employment or undergo a course of education that is full-time or a combination of both that equals full-time
.

Def is not to consume or possess any drugs or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician, with random testing

No Contact with any users or traffickers of illicit drugs or controlled substances
.

Complete any other assessment or evaluation PO deems necessary and follow-through with any treatment recommended

The DOC can exercise it's discretion in terms of establishing any other terms or conditions of probation and the defendant is to comply with recommendations

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

Pay DOC Supervision fees

Credit for 10 days if probation is ever revoked

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt

records.addlTxt:
State by Hynek / Def w/ Atty Patricia O'Neil
Hynek addresses sentencing recommendation from PSI
O'Neil comments - 1 error in PSI - comments on recommendations
CRT:  unusual for me to not include any penalty....unless any violation of probation is minor, you can fully expect prison if you are revoked
Ineligible Voting Notice filed
CRT'S SENTENCE:  Sent w/held;  Probation 30 mos w/ conditions:  Obtain & maintain full-time employment or course of education or a combination of both;  No Contact w/ any drug users or traffickers;  No drugs or cont subs w/o valid prescription, w/ random testing;  Pay $440 for Buy Money to West Central MEG;  Complete 100 hrs Comm Serv. work;  Complete any other assessments the PO deems necessary & follow-thru w/ trmt recommended;  The DOC can exercise it's discretion in terms of establishing any other terms or conditions & the def is to comply with recommendations;  Pay CC & DOC fees;  Credit for 10 days if probation is ever revoked

ADDRESS INFO for Ronnie A Rutledge Sr
Current: 1116 S 4th st Apt 3, La Crosse, WI 54601 United States  (Effective: 06-24-2015)
Prior: 1533 Mississippi St, La Crosse, WI 54601

10:45 AM - Def in court w/Atty Meredith Davis f/  Patricia Linda O'Neil.  Emily Hynek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Ct. 1 - delivery of controlled sub - guilty
SNP filed/signed/understands
  Plea Quest filed/signed/understands
  Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment filed
Understands const rights waived
Understands elements of crime
No promises/threats
No alc/drugs/meds in the last 24 hrs  
Plea is F, V & I made. Sufficient factual basis to support the plea and the def is found guilty.
Davis: he's on EM for curfew - there's no supervisor willing to take the time to give him the documentation that he needs but they have indicated that if JSS wants to call them ....
CRT: EM will be removed.
SEH: 6 weeks - Need an hr
PSI due one week b/f sentencing
ejss

3:47 PM - Def in court w/Atty Patricia L. O'Neil.  Justine L. Suleski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
O'Neil: he's been on EM for 2 mos now and doing well. JSS isn't allwoing him to extend curfew for work requirments. He could be getting in OT. I am asking to have the EM removed or instruct JSS to make exception for employment. He posted $500.00 bond and ask that it be returned. It's set for P/S on  6/24. It's a plea to the charge and PSI but we are still talking maybe about probation
Suleski: defer to court
Bond: curfew to remain but he can be outside the curfew hrs for employment to be documents w/in 24 hrs to JSS. 
$2500.00 sig bond w/ same conditions - refund cash bond
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 24, 2015 at 10:45 am.

11 am Def in court w/ Atty Patricia L. O'Neil.  Def in custody.  Jessica Skemp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea discussions.  Prelim waiver filed - signed/understands.  No promises/threats.
COURT finds the waiver of the PH is F & V made.  Bound over for trial.
Information filed - Reading waived.  Def Pleads NG - NG Pleas entered.
PTC:  5/1 at 2:30 pm    STC:  5/28 at 10 am   SLH
O'Neil argues for a sig bond.  The recommendation right now is for probation.  Skemp comments and feels some cash is appropriate.
COURT comments.  $500 cash bond with the same conditions.   Also add 10 pm to 6 am curfew to be enforced on em through JSS.

for TWB

  Pretrial report filed
